LanguageData.MineralDeposits.label: 矿物矿床
LanguageData.MineralDeposits.description: Underground deposits of minerals. A Mine Extractor can be placed here to extract ores.
LanguageData.RareMineralDeposits.label: 稀有矿物矿床
LanguageData.RareMineralDeposits.description: Underground deposits of rare minerals. An Advanced Mine Extractor can be placed here to extract rare ores.
LanguageData.Oilfield.label: 原油沉积点
LanguageData.Oilfield.description: Rich underground deposits of Crude Oil. A Drilling Rig can drill an oil fissure here. An Oil Extractor can then be placed to extract Crude Oil.
LanguageData.MineableSteel.label: 铁矿
LanguageData.MineableSteel.description: Deposits of Iron Ore. Iron Ore has a variety of uses as an economic metal, being abundant and easy to process. It can be strengthened by being mixed with other metals into alloys.
LanguageData.MineableSilver.label: 银矿
LanguageData.MineableSilver.description: Deposits of Silver Ore. Silver Ore is useful as the primary currency for trading.
LanguageData.MineableGold.label: 金矿
LanguageData.MineableGold.description: Deposits of Gold Ore. Gold Ore is a very valuable and precious metal. The allure of this rare beautiful metal is known to bring out terrible greed in people.
LanguageData.MineableNitre.label: 硝石矿
LanguageData.MineableNitre.description: Deposits of Nitre. Major uses of potassium nitrate are in fertilizers, tree stump removal, rocket propellants and fireworks. It is one of the major components of gunpowder.
LanguageData.MineableCoal.label: 煤矿
LanguageData.MineableCoal.description: Deposits of Coal Ore. Coal is useful as a reaction agent in metal alloy production.
LanguageData.MineablePlasteel.label: 镍矿
LanguageData.MineablePlasteel.description: Lateritic nickel ore deposits are surficial, weathered rinds formed on ultramafic rocks. Nickel Ore contains Nickel and small amounts of Cobalt.
LanguageData.MineableTin.label: 锡矿
LanguageData.MineableTin.description: Tin Ore is the second-easiest ore to mine. It is mined from Tin Veins.
LanguageData.MineableCopper.label: 铜矿
LanguageData.MineableCopper.description: Copper occurs naturally as native copper and was known to some of the oldest civilizations on record. Copper is useful for conduction of electrical currents, and is often used as wiring.
LanguageData.MineableAluminium.label: 铝土矿
LanguageData.MineableAluminium.description: Bauxite is the ore of Aluminium. Aluminum is similar to copper as it is also highly conductive to electrical currents. It is less valuable than copper. Unlike copper however, aluminum can only be processed at an Electric Smelting Furnace. The refining process requires electrical currents in order to make Aluminum Alloy.
LanguageData.MineableTitanium.label: 钛铁矿
LanguageData.MineableTitanium.description: Ilmenite is the ore of Titanium. Titanium is a very durable metal and is often used in alloys to produce metals much stronger than steel.
LanguageData.MineableManganese.label: 软锰矿
LanguageData.MineableManganese.description: Pyrolusite is the ore of Maganese. Maganese is a metal with high magnetism.
LanguageData.MineableTungsten.label: 黑钨矿
LanguageData.MineableTungsten.description: Wolframite is the ore of Tungsten. Tungsten is a strong and quite dense material with a high melting temperature used for electric filaments and armor-piercing ammunition, as well as hard tungsten carbide machine tools.
LanguageData.MineableGlowstone.label: 耀石矿
LanguageData.MineableGlowstone.description: Rock containing bits of a strange glowing gem.
LanguageData.MineableSalt.label: 压实的盐
LanguageData.MineableColdstone.label: 冰石矿
LanguageData.MineableColdstone.description: Rock containing bits of a strangely cold gem.
